title: Prince Andrew named in Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell court documents
description: Hundreds of pages of court documents relating to Ghislaine Maxwell, her relationship with Jeffrey Epstein and alleged victims of sexual abuse have been released.

title: Rishi Sunak must allow civil service to plan for Labour government under Keir Starmer
description: The Institute for Government warns time is running out for Labour to discuss its plans for government with the civil service if Rishi Sunak calls a general election in May

title: Starmer issues call to arms to Labour ahead of UK general election
description: Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer will put the opposition party on high alert for a general election as he tells British voters that “the opportunity to shape our country’s future rests in your hands” in a speech on Thursday.

title: Conservative-Labour power transfer talks ‘must start this month’
description: Institute for Government think tank warns time is running out amid speculation Rishi Sunak could call snap May election

title: Iran vows revenge after more than 100 killed in blasts near tomb of former commander
description: Iranian president Ebrahim Raisi has labelled an attack at a cemetery which killed more than 100 people as “heinous and inhumane”.

title: Keir Starmer distances himself from Jeremy Corbyn and attacks the Tories as he vows his premiership would not be 'vanity dressed up as virtue'
description: Sir Keir will use his speech in the west of England today to once again highlight his experience as director of public prosecutions where he made 'life-and-death decisions'.

title: Sir Keir Starmer to launch election campaign with vow to change the 'character of politics'
description: The Labour leader will be launching his election bid for 2024, following similar addresses from Liberal Democrat leader Sir Ed Davey and Reform UK chief Richard Tice.

title: Voters are right to be ‘anti-Westminster’, Starmer says in bid to channel anger
description: Voters are “right to be anti-Westminster”, Sir Keir Starmer will claim in a bid to channel the anger of people who have become alienated by politics.

title: Hold on to ‘flickering hope that things can be better’, Starmer to urge voters
description: In a major speech, Labour leader will say the only chance of ‘national renewal’ is to ‘defeat this miserablist Tory project’

title: Labour election win would lift downtrodden UK, Keir Starmer to say
description: In a speech in the west of England, Labour leader will say he wants British people to believe in politics again

title: Rishi Sunak to launch full-throated defence of his five pledges and beg voters to keep the faith
description: RISHI Sunak will today launch a full-throated defence of his five pledges and beg voters to keep the faith. The PM will claim “great progress” has been made on the one-year anniversary of his

title: Unions’ real motivation to strike is to damage the Tories politically in election year
description: Wreckers’ plot JUST four days into 2024 the unions are busy orchestrating the shutdown of Britain. The junior doctors, led abysmally by the BMA’s Corbynite dolts, downed stethoscopes yesterday for

title: STEPHEN GLOVER: Is Keir Starmer wise to cosy up to Tony Blair, a man who has benefited financially from a panoply of autocrats?
description: After Sir Tony Blair was condemned by the 2016 Chilcot Inquiry into the Iraq War, many assumed that the former Prime Minister would disappear from public life.

title: Keir Starmer tells Rishi Sunak 'bring it on' as Labour are ready for election battle
description: Labour leader Keir Starmer warned voters couldn't afford another year of Tory misery - and said cowardly Rishi Sunak was scared of putting his record to the voters

title: Keir Starmer’s caution conceals a radical plan
description: Labour leader has an ambitious programme for government but does he have the skills to sell it to a weary electorate?

title: Keir Starmer pledges to bring hope to an ‘exhausted’ Britain
description: Tories can’t change Britain, so they try to undermine the possibility of change itself,’ Labour leader tells voters

title: Reform UK's Richard Tice rejects truce pleas of ‘terrified’ Tory MPs
description: He said many have pleaded for his party not to stand in marginal seats, repeating Nigel Farage’s 2019 truce. However he said all Tory MPs should be held responsible for “broken Britain” and Reform UK will stand “in every single seat”.

title: Keir Starmer’s bid to distance himself from Jeremy Corbyn brutally derailed by video
description: Sir Keir Starmer ’s bid to distance himself from Jeremy Corbyn has been brutally derailed by a video showing the Labour leader paying tribute to his predecessor on several occasions.

title: Nigel Farage terrifies the Tories, but the Lib Dems will win more seats
description: Although Reform UK is gaining in the polls, Ed Davey’s party is more likely to elect MPs and councillors in the ‘Blue Wall’

title: Despite what we’ll hear in election year, the UK can’t be resuscitated
description: THE Union is beyond resuscitation. Sunak and Starmer, on behalf of the British establishment, will disingenuously do their utmost to convince

title: Reform UK - "The Tories are terrified"
description: Reform UK leader, Richard Tice, has warned the country faces "Starmergeddon" if it elects Labour. The party has been setting out its aims and policies at the start of a new year that will almost certainly - at some point - include a general election.

title: Starmer urges voters to reject ‘populism and cynicism’ ahead of next election
description: The Labour leader will claim the Tories have ‘no practical achievements to point towards’ after nearly 14 years in Government.

title: Lib Dem leader Ed Davey launches 'Tory Removal Service'
description: The Liberal Democrats are the "Tory Removal Service", Sir Ed Davey has said as he began 2024 campaigning in seats in Surrey held by senior ministers. The party leader drove a poster van displaying the message through Guildford, a Lib Dem election target.

title: Labour suggests councillor has 'extreme views' after defection
description: In response to the surprise defection, a Labour Party spokesperson said: "Under Keir Starmer's leadership the Labour Party has changed fundamentally. The Labour Party is no longer a party of protest. The Labour Party will go into the next General Election with a credible, sensible and deliverable offer.

title: London Playbook PM: Making excuses for Nigel
description: Ouch: “If Nigel isn’t one of the candidates, it means he doesn’t believe they can win a seat,” former UKIP and then Brexit Party MEP Bill Etheridge told Playbook PM. “Nigel is lending a little support to them while keeping his options open.” (Tice dismissed questions about Farage mulling a move to the Tories.)

title: Reform rules out Tory pact as Sunak faces pressure to call election
description: Richard Tice, the leader of the Nigel Farage-linked party, claimed the Tories are ‘terrified’ of the threat Reform poses.

title: Labour Leader Keir Starmer Fires Starting Gun on UK ‘Election Year’
description: Labour leader Keir Starmer will make his opening pitch to voters in what is widely expected to be a UK election year, declaring that Britain is “crying out for change” after 14 years of Conservative governments.

title: Keir Starmer to condemn Tories who treat politics like a ‘hobby’
description: Sir Keir Starmer is expected to use a speech on Thursday to accuse Lord Cameron of Chipping Norton and Boris Johnson of treating politics like a “hobby” and wielding power for the sake of it. The Labour leader will say that politics is not a “game” and a “pastime for people who enjoy the feeling of power” but should be considered a “higher cause”.

title: Sir Keir Starmer to promise 'total crackdown on cronyism'
description: The Labour leader will kickstart his party's campaign for the next general election - thought to be this year - with a pledge to clean up politics following a series of scandals.

title: Keir Starmer seeks new year boost before 2024 election
description: Labour leader Keir Starmer is trying to do exactly that with a speech on Thursday in a marginal seat near Bristol. Don't expect any new policies. There won't be any. Instead, he is arguing he is taking on two opponents this year. Firstly, as you would ...

title: Fear of recession adds to Tory woes in election year
description: The downbeat news delivers a blow to Tory prime minister Rishi Sunak, who trails Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer in the polls despite a sharp slowdown of inflation. Gross domestic product (GDP) contracted 0.1 per cent between July and September on sliding ...

title: Keir Starmer to promise ‘total crackdown on cronyism’
description: Sir Keir Starmer is promising a “total crackdown on cronyism ” if he becomes prime minister, with jail sentences of more than a decade for those who defraud the government.

title: Keir Starmer seeks new year boost before 2024 election
description: In response, Conservative Party Chairman Richard Holden says Starmer is a "weather vane" who will tell the public "whatever he thinks they want to hear on any given day". Welcome to 2024. There will be plenty more where this comes from, from all sides.

description: The control by the centre and the lack of independent thought in the party are my biggest concern. Starmer remains quite an

description: It will probably not be enough to keep Rishi Sunak in power — but it might at least stave off the landslide that currently looks inevitable

description: The FTSE 100 will open at 8am. Among the companies with reports and trading updates today are Entain, Plus 500 and Wizz Air. Read the Wednesday 3 January Business Live blog below.

title: Reform UK leader rules out helping Tories at general election and says party will stand in every seat in Britain – UK politics live
description: Nigel Farage does not appear at Reform UK press conference as Richard Tice says ‘a good poker player does not show his hand early’

title: Could Labour be the accountant’s best friend?
description: It is almost certain that 2024 will be an election year. Judging by polling over the past few months, Labour are odds-on favourites to take power towards

title: Labour 'set to scale back' ban on lobbying for former ministers
description: LABOUR are likely to scale back a pledge to ban former ministers from lobbying jobs for five years ahead of a push to “crackdown on

title: Tens of thousands turn out to support trail-hunting at festive meets
description: Tens of thousands of people turned out to support hunting over the festive period, and thousands backed a new campaign to oppose restrictions on trail-hunting. Huge crowds were reported across the country,

title: Nigel Farage is a no-show as his party blasts ‘socialist twins’ Starmer and Sunak
description: The absent Brexiteer is ‘giving a lot of thought’ to his future with Reform UK, says party leader Richard Tice.

title: Reform UK needs Nigel Farage back soon
description: Business confidence and the government’s grip on parliament might be better under Labour but the country’s fundamental problems will be the same whoever wins the election. A stagnant economy, struggling public services and unstable foreign affairs won’t disappear with a change in ministers.

title: Labour to table tougher punishment for defrauding government
description: Sir Keir Starmer is set to unveil plans to “restore standards in public life with a total crackdown on cronyism”. The Labour leader will reveal his blueprint on Thursday that could see people who defraud the government face going to jail for more than ...

title: Labour wavers on pledge to ban former UK ministers from lobbying for 5 years
description: Labour has put into question its pledge to impose a five-year ban on former UK ministers lobbying the government for sectors they oversaw, despite Sir Keir Starmer vowing to clean up British politics.

title: Nigel Farage 'Still Assessing' Political Comeback, Says Reform UK Leader
description: Nigel Farage is still “assessing” whether to make a return to the frontline of politics, the leader of the right-wing Reform UK party has said. In a press conference in Westminster on Wednesday morning, Richard Tice said he hoped Farage would be involved in the general election campaign.

title: Rachel Reeves skewered over 'fantasy economics' – told to stop being dishonest with voters
description: Labour is reportedly considering slashing taxes - but have yet to detail how they would afford their substantial spending commitments.

title: How can employers work with government to break down the class ceiling?
description: As we head into an election year, Keir Starmer still has to win over the electorate on a plethora of divisive issues.

title: Clear the field for the B-teams
description: MIGRATION FALLOUT: Two Playbooks ran through Tuesday’s asylum backlog figures ding-dong, but the aftermath continues. The Times leads its spread on Home Secretary James Cleverly saying it’s “impossible to say” when the overall (not legacy) backlog will be cleared. And the Mail’s headline is: “Can Cleverly really get boat crossings to ZERO in 2024?”

title: Scottish Greens: Party plans to stand more candidates at next GE
description: The Scottish Greens are aiming to run in more seats at the next general election than in 2019, its leaders have said.

title: Tory Party spent ‘unprecedentedly’ high figure on Rishi Sunak Facebook ads in December
description: Sunak appeared to buy more adverts in the last three months than Keir Starmer has in the three years and eight months he’s been Labour leader, which Who Targets Me stressed was a reminder of how digital campaigns are set to influence general elections in ...
